info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:45PM CDT until May 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR RANDALL...SOUTHEASTERN OLDHAM...EASTERN DEAF SMITH AND POTTER COUNTIES... At 645 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Valley De Oro to 5 miles northeast of Umbarger to 6 miles southwest of Buffalo Lake, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Dawn, Valley De Oro, Umbarger and Timbercreek Canyon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
